synonyms: valid "this piece of legislation is not yet operative"

definitions.definition: (of a word) having the most relevance or significance in a phrase or sentence.
examples: a young man, and the operative word is young, should go into the armed services at around seventeen
they had wounds needing operative treatment

definitions.definition: a worker, especially a skilled one in a manufacturing industry.
examples: machinist, (machine) operator, mechanic, engineer, worker, workman, blue-collar worker the operatives clean the machines

definitions.definition: a private detective or secret agent.
examples: agent, secret agent, undercover agent, spy, mole, plant, double agent; Moreinformalspook; archaicintelligencer "an operative of the CIA"detective, private detective, investigator, private investigator, sleuth; informalprivate eye, bloodhound; informalgumshoe, dick, private dick "we hired our own operatives"Morespook; intelligencer an operative of the CIAdetective, private detective, investigator, private investigator, sleuth; private eye, bloodhound; gumshoe, dick, private dick we hired our own operatives
